Articles: {"abstract": "A new ad from Pfister parodies a classic Calvin Klein Obsession commercial to poke fun at campaigns that portray household faucets as luxury goods.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/14/business/media/with-a-whisper-pfister-takes-a-comedic-jab-at-highbrow-faucet-commercials.html", "snippet": "A new ad from Pfister parodies a classic Calvin Klein Obsession commercial to poke fun at campaigns that portray household faucets as luxury goods.", "lead_paragraph": "HOUSEHOLD faucets are the essence of functionality, but they are often advertised as luxury goods. Last year, for example, one of the leading faucet brands, Moen, introduced a television commercial in which a model in an evening dress sashays into a bathroom and puts on a gleaming, oversize necklace. The necklace then slips from her neck and, through digital animation, scatters into pieces on the counter, reassembling as a faucet. \u201cStatement piece for your bathroom,\u201d says a voice-over.
